createGroup(parameters)

Create a new firewall group on the current account.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#firewall_group_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
description string <optional>
 Description of firewall group.
Source:
  • firewall.js, line 59

createRule(parameters)

Create a rule in a firewall group.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#firewall_group_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
FIREWALLGROUPID string Target firewall group.
direction string Direction of rule. Possible values: "in".
ip_type string IP address type. Possible values: "v4", "v6".
protocol string Protocol type. Possible values: "icmp", "tcp", "udp", "gre".
subnet string IP address representing a subnet. The IP address format must match with the "ip_type" parameter value.
subnet_size string IP prefix size in bits.
port string <optional>
 TCP/UDP only. This field can be an integer value specifying a port or a colon separated port range.
notes string <optional>
 This field supports notes up to 255 characters.
Source:
  • firewall.js, line 80

deleteGroup(parameters)

Delete a firewall group. Use this function with caution because the firewall group being deleted will be detached from all servers. This can result in open ports accessible to the internet.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#firewall_group_delete
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
FIREWALLGROUPID string Firewall group to delete.
Source:
  • firewall.js, line 38

https://www.vultr.com/api/#firewall_group_list

parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description

 Filter result set to only contain this firewall group.

listRules(parameters)

List the rules in a firewall group.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#firewall_rule_list
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
FIREWALLGROUPID string Target firewall group.
direction string Server IP to use when creating default records (A and MX).
ip_type string IP address type. Possible values: "v4", "v6".
